p.sent: The DDR is a DAISY DTB reader.
The DAISY protocol was developed by the DAISY.ORG consortium to serve as a standard for the production of Accessible Digital Books around the world.

As an evolution of the LIDA software, DDR adopts this new format (DAISY 3.0) and preserves the navigational and interactive functions found in LIDA and developed by Dorina Nowill Foundation for the Blind (FDNC).
On this tutorial you will find all the necessary information to use the DDR software.
If you are reading this tutorial from the TUTORIAL command (T key or the help button on DDR ), you can return at anytime to the book you were reading pressing ESC.
To navigate the Tutorial topics, use the left and right arrows on the keyboard.
To go forward or back through phrases, use the down and up arrows.
To pause your reading, use the Spacebar.
To resume playing, use the Spacebar again.
To control the TTS volume, use Plus(+) and Minus(-) keys, and to control the audio volume, use CONTROL + Plus(+) and CONTROL + Minus(-).
Use the period(.) or comma(,) keys to increase or decrease TTS speed.
To exit DDR , press ESC at anytime (or use the X button on the upper right of the screen) and confirm pressing ENTER.
This command is disabled when a dialog is open.
Press ESC to exit the dialog and use ESC again to close the application.

You have two ways to open a book.
If it is the first time you are reading this book, you must use the Open command.
Press O or click on the Open New Book button.
Follow the dialog instructions.
The default folder to store your books is My Library in My Documents.
If you have already read the book on this computer, you can use History.
Press H or click on the History tab.
If the book is missing or there is a fatal error, you will receive a visual and talking message.
Press ESC to close the dialog and return to the main screen.

level1.p: Let's see the details of these functions.

level2.p: After pressing O or clicking the Open New Book button, you will have three options:

p.sent: The first one uses the default Open File dialog from Windows.
You will have to search for the folder which has the OPF file for the book you want to read.
If the book is on a CD, you have to locate the CD drive and then you must find the OPF file.
You can use your screen reader application while using the dialog.
Once found the OPF file, open it clicking the open button of the dialog, or press ENTER.
The book will open in a few seconds, depending on its size and the computer speed.
DDR plays an opening sound during this operation.
The second option automatically reads all titles stored on your Library folder and creates a book list that you can navigate using the up and down arrows.
To open a book from the list, you must find it and press ENTER while hearing its title.
The library folder location can be edited using the Global Preferences dialog (C).
DDR plays an opening sound during the book opening.
The third option is similar to the second one, but all of your hard drives are searched.
This can take a long time, depending on the number of files you have on your drives.
After the list creation, proceed as in the second option.
When you press H or click on the History tab, the system will start reading the recent books list.
The reading order is from the most recent to the older ones.
The History list size is configured using the Global Preferences dialog (C).
The default number is 100 books.
You can navigate through the History list using the Up and Down arrows or clicking the corresponding buttons.
To pause and resume the list reading, use Spacebar.
To open a book, press ENTER when you hear the book title or click on the book title.
The Right and Left arrows plus the CONTROL key will navigate to the end and begin of the list.
To remove a History entry, with History active, use Up and Down arrows to select the entry you wish to remove and press Spacebar to stop on it.
Use DELETE to remove the entry.
A confirmation dialog will open.
Use ENTER to confirm or ESC to cancel, or use the corresponding buttons.
To remove all History entries, with History active, press CONTROL + DELETE.
A confirmation dialog will open.
Use ENTER to confirm or ESC to cancel, or use the corresponding buttons.
After opening a book, you can hear or read the book info, like the title, author, publisher and the book last reading date.
To navigate this info, use the Up and Down arrows, or the corresponding buttons.
As in any other reading screen, you can press Spacebar to pause and resume the reading.

level2.p: If you are in another mode, as the reading or index mode, you can hear the book info pressing HOME or pressing the corresponding button.

p.sent: After opening the book, you can access its index.
Press I or click on the Index button.
If you are on the reading screen, you can also click on the INDEX tab.
The Index reading starts from the last read item of the current book, using the chosen navigation level.
The DAISY books can have up to six navigation levels.
You can choose the visualization and navigation level of the index pressing the numbers 1 to 6 or using the Level selection box.
When you are on the index mode, changing the level will show the corresponding sections and subsections in the index.
The reading continues from the current point.
For example, if you are in a level 4 topic and chooses level 2, the reading will resume from the closer level 2 topic.
Using this function makes it easier to find a specific subsection from top levels.
The chosen level for each book is automatically saved in your preferences.
Use the Up and Down arrows to navigate through the Index items.
The CONTROL + J command turns the Index automatic navigation on and off, as it does in all other lists.

level2.p: After finding the desired topic, press ENTER or click on the topic to read from this point.
Use the CONTROL + Left arrow or CONTROL + Right arrow to navigate to the start and end of the list.

p.sent: You have many options to start reading the book.
Pressing L you will start from the beginning.
With V, you will return to the last reading point.
From the Index, press ENTER on a topic and you will access the topic on the book window and start reading it.
Using the Bookmarks list, the accessed point is the chosen bookmark.
You may also navigate using the Search results list.
Once the reading has started, you can pause and resume it using Spacebar or the corresponding buttons.
To turn the footnotes reading on and off, press N or the footnote indicator button.
When the footnotes reading is disabled, a specific sound indicates a footnote is present in this point of the book.
The Footnote indicator also changes its state.
The presence of Bookmarks will also be marked by a sound and the indicator button status changes.
To switch this function on and off use the CONTROL + ALT + M keys, or click the Bookmark indicator button.
This function can also be activated or deactivated in the global preferences.
To navigate between phrases, use the Up arrow or Down arrow, or the corresponding buttons.
To jump to the headings of the chosen level, use the Right and Left arrows.
The navigation level corresponds to the book sections.
Thus, chapters will usually be level 1, subsections will be higher levels.
Some books have no more than one or two levels.
Others can use the 1st level to different divisions, like Book 1, Book 2, or Part 1 and Part 2.
The maximum number of levels is 6.
To select a navigation level, press the numbers from 1 to 6 or use the Level selection box.
This selection is automatically saved with the book preferences, so each book has its own level saved.
Please note that if you are navigating with a high level, like level 4, you will go through all the lower levels too - in this example, levels 3, 2 and 1.
The level preference is shared between the index and the book reading.

level2.p: To restart the reading of the phrase you're on, press V.
To return to the book start, press L.
To turn on and off the automatic book navigation, press J.
To access the index, press I.

level2.p: To navigate in the text through the last search results, press CONTROL + Down arrow to the next result or CONTROL + Up arrow to the previous result.

Remember that you must use Z to switch to TTS reading before using X.

The Search function will be explained later.

To hear the words of the selected text, use TAB to the next word and SHIFT + TAB to the previous one, or use the corresponding buttons.

To control the TTS volume use plus(+) or minus(-); to change the speed, press period(.) or comma(,).

To choose the font size for the text, press F.
The Right and Left arrows and the Up and Down arrows also navigate through the words.

To close the spelling dialog, press ESC or click the close button.

p.sent: Bookmarks allow easy and direct navigation to any phrase in the book.
Besides working as common bookmarks, DAISY bookmarks incorporates the user's note function.
Any bookmark can have text attached to it.
This text can be exported together with the reference, making it possible to edit this text in your preferred text editor.
When you are in reading mode, to insert a new bookmark, press M or click in the corresponding button.
To edit an existing bookmark, you must go to it, using the Bookmarks list or finding it in the text, and then press the same key or button.
When the dialog window for editing or inserting a bookmark is opened, the bookmark title field will be activated.
Press CONTROL + L to read the current text.
You can edit the suggested title, which is the first sixty characters of the selected text on the book.
To erase the entire title, press CONTROL + DEL.
To edit the title, use the Right and Left arrows to navigate through the text units (words, symbols or spaces).
To spell the last spoken word or unit, use CONTROL + S.
To navigate on a letter level on the current word, use the Up and Down arrows.
The DEL key erases the last unit spoken (word, symbol or space).
Typing after hearing a unit, you will insert the typed text in the current location.
The text will be always inserted before the current unit, if you are using the Up and Down arrows.
If you are using the Left and Right arrows, the text will be inserted before the current unit only if you are not at the end of the field.
Use Backspace to delete the previous letter or symbol.
You can use CONTROL + Z to undo the last edition or CONTROL + Y to redo the last undone operation.
To edit the user's note field, press tab from the title field.
The edit functions are the same for both fields.
To confirm the creation or edition made, press CONTROL + ENTER or click on the OK button.
To discard the edition or creation, use ESC or click the button CANCEL.
Once created, the bookmark will be part of the Bookmarks list for this book and is automatically saved with the book preferences.
You can export your markers to use them in another computer using the export function (not active on this version).
When editing a bookmark, you can remove it permanently pressing ALT + R.
There is no confirmationdialog.
The bookmark will be deleted.
To export your bookmarks with the notes and the text reference, use the E Key.
Follow the instructions in the dialog box to export all bookmarks of the open book.
The exported file in txt format will be stored in "My Notes" inside "My Library" folder in "My Documents", and will have the book title and date of export as filename.
You can edit the content in any text editor.
To set the number of sentences to be exported along with your notes, open the configuration dialog by using the C key, and change the definition of "Phrases to export with notes".

level2.p: The Bookmarks List can be accessed using CONTROL + M or clicking the BOOKMARKS tab.

p.sent: It contains all bookmarks for the current book.
To navigate through the list, use the Up and Down arrows.
The Right and Left arrows jump to the end and to the beginning of the list.
To start reading the book from a bookmark location, press Enter while hearing the bookmark title or click the title on the list.
Using CONTROL + J switches on and off the automatic list navigation.
To remove a Bookmark entry, with Bookmarks List active, use Up and Down arrows to select the entry you wish to remove and press Spacebar to stop on it.
Use DELETE to remove the entry.
A confirmation dialog will open.
Use ENTER to confirm or ESC to cancel, or use the corresponding buttons.
To remove all Bookmark entries from a book, with Bookmarks List active, press CONTROL + DELETE.
A confirmation dialog will open.
Use ENTER to confirm or ESC to cancel, or use the corresponding buttons.

level2.p: To do a word or phrase search in the book while reading, press P or click the corresponding button.
In the dialog opened, you have two options: type in the new search word or phrase, or select the text from a recent search made on the current or other book.

span.span: There are two types of search: Similar
Text
and Exact text.
It is important to note that in the Exact text mode, the search for more than one term does not find results that do not correspond exactly to what is typed.

sent.span: Otherwise, for one term, the search results will bring sections that contain any word derived from the search term.
Thus, if you type one, you will find someone, anyone, everyone and so on

span.span: Using the
Similar Text

search mode, the system will search for all words and ranks the results by relevance. To select a search mode use the TAB key until the field named Search Type is selected and choose which mode do you want to use. The Similar Text modo will only operate if you are using a book produced with DDP (Dorina Daisy Producer).

p.sent: To do a new search, type the word or phrase and press ENTER.
The results will be shown in the Search Results List.
To repeat a previous search, use CONTROL + UP arrow or CONTROL + DOWN arrow to navigate through the recent searches list and choose the search you want to do.
After selecting the search, press ENTER to execute it.
Press ESC if want to close the dialog without execute the search.
You can use the edition commands similar to the Bookmark edition commands to edit the search terms or phrase.
After executing the search, the system will read the results list.
See next topic to learn how to navigate that list.

level2.p: At anytime you can access the Search Results list using CONTROL + P or clicking the SEARCH tab.

p.sent: After executing a search, the results, if any, will be shown in the Search Results List.
At the same time, the system closes the search dialog, moves its focus to the Search Results List and starts reading it.
Use ENTER to select the desired result and go to the referred point in the text.
To navigate through the list, use the same navigation commands you use for the Index or the Bookmarks list.
At any time you can access the Search Results List pressing CONTROL + P or clicking the SEARCH tab.

level2.p: To navigate the book text jumping through the search results, use CONTROL + DOWN arrow or CONTROL + UP arrow.

p.sent: To open DDR Global Preferences dialog, press C or click in the corresponding button.
To navigate through preferences, use TAB and SHIFT + TAB to go to the next or previous preference.
After reaching the desired preference, follow the spoken instructions to set the value.
Some options are selected using the UP and DOWN arrows, others by pressing the Spacebar to activate or deactivate them, while others may require typing some text in the selected field.
To confirm your choices, press ENTER or click the OK button.
To discard the changes and close the dialog, click on CANCEL or press ESC.

level1.p: Bellow follows a list of the global preferences:

p.sent: Interface Language: Select the language you wish to use in the interface.
All warnings and alerts will also be translated to the chosen language.
System Voice: Allows to select the TTS voice that will be used by DDR to speak the application commands, alerts and warnings.
The listed voices will be the installed ones in the chosen language and SAPI 5 compatible.
If there is no voice installed that uses your language, an alert will be shown and all installed voices will be listed.
TTS Speed : Choose the desired speed for the TTS voice.
Values from -10 to +10.
TTS Volume: Choose the TTS voice volume.
Corresponds to +(plus) and -(minus) keys.
Screen Font Size: You can choose a Font Size for the Book, Index, Bookmarks List, Search Results and History boxes.
The font sizes are relative to the default value.
Corresponds to the F key.

level1.p: History Entries: Number of entries saved and shown on the History tab.
Typing Echo: Switches on and of the typing echo (each character is spoken) in the text input fields.
Commands Echo: Switches on and off the commands echo (commands are spoken) for each command you use.
Bookmark Beep: Switches on and off the bookmark indicator sound.

p.sent: Automatic List Navigation : Switches on and off the automatic list navigation.
Corresponds to CONTROL + J.

level1.p: Text Extended Edition: Switches on and off the text edit functions for the input text fields in Bookmarks and Search dialogs.

span.span: Phrases to export with notes
: Sets the number of sentences before and after a marked section to be exported along with the notes of a book.

level1.p: Library Folder (full path): If you don't want to use the default folder, which is My Library in My Documents, you must type here the full path to the folder where you want to store your local books.

p.sent: To open the Book Preferences dialog, use CONTROL + C or click the corresponding button.
The Book Preferences allows you to choose many options, valid for each book independently.
To navigate through preferences, use TAB and SHIFT + TAB to go to the next or previous preference.
After reaching the desired preference, follow the spoken instructions to set the value.
Some options are selected using the UP and DOWN arrows, others by pressing the Spacebar to activate or deactivate them, while others may require typing some text in the selected field.
To confirm your choices, press ENTER or click the OK button.
To discard the changes and close the dialog, click on CANCEL or press ESC.

level1.p: Bellow follows a list of the Book Preferences:

p.sent: Audio Volume(MP3): choose the desired audio volume for the pre-recorded book narration, if it exists.
Corresponds to CONTROL + +(plus) and CONTROL + -(minus)
List voices in all languages: Activating this option, the system will list all TTS voices available in your system.
By default, only the voices in the book language will be listed.
TTS voice: Here you can select the TTS voice that will be used to read the current book.
The listed voices will be the installed ones that are SAPI 5 compatible.
Automatic Book Navigation : Switches on and off the automatic book navigation.
Corresponds to J.
Footnote reading: Switches on and off footnote reading.
Corresponds to the N key.
Page Number reading: Switches on and off page number reading.
Corresponds to the CONTROL + G key.
Read with MP3: Switches on and off the use of the audio pre-recorded narration of the book.
If switched off, the book will be read by TTS.
Corresponds to Z key.

span.span: By clicking on the corresponding button on the top right or by using the U key, DDReader will open a dialog box to access the update page.
If there is a newer version, it will open automatically and you must confirm the update by pressing ENTER.
You must restart Firefox after the update.
To browse the update page you will need to use your screen reader.
Updates can also be made by Firefox automatically if you are connected to the Internet.
A confirmation window will appear and prompt you to press ENTER to update.

p.sent: To use the support option, click on the corresponding button or press R.
To use this function you must have an active connection to the Web.The application will alert you that a web page will be opened in a new Firefox window.
The web page will show a field for the message type, one for your email address and one for your message.
After typing the text in the fields, press ENTER to send the message, or ALT + F4 to close the page.
After sending the message, you will receive an answer if it was successfully received by the remote system.

h1.span: 14.Bookmarks and User notes exporting and Global Preferences export and import.

p.sent: To export your bookmarks with the notes and the text reference, use the E Key.
Follow the instructions in the dialog box to export all bookmarks of the open book.
The exported file in txt format will be stored in "My Notes" inside "My Library" folder in "My Documents", and will have the book title and date of export as filename.
You can edit the content in any text editor.
To set the number of sentences to be exported along with your notes, open the configuration dialog by using the C key, and change the definition of "Phrases to export with notes".

span.span: This command also provides access to export and import General Settings, including global and book preferences (once the book is open).
Bookmarks will be exported along with the settings.
Follow the instructions in the dialog box to perform the operation.
The exported file will be stored in "My Library" under "My Documents" and will be named "config.zip".
To import your settings in another computer, open DDReader in the new computer and select this option by pressing E.
The
Config.zip
file should be copied to the "My Library" in "My Documents".
The new settings will cover the previous settings, so, if you wish, make a copy of the current settings before importing.

p.sent: Type Q or CONTROL + END or click the corresponding button to access the Credits dialog.
At the end of the credits page, you will find the full licence text.
Press ESC to close the dialog.
